intro: Impatiens eryaleia subsp. mbeyaensis, commonly known as the Mbeya impatiens, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa, particularly Tanzania. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
